# Unit

**Class**

An abstract class representing a unit of measure.

## Declaration

```swift
class Unit
```

## Overview

Each instance of an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Unit] subclass consists of a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Unit/symbol], which can be used to create string representations of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] objects with the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/MeasurementFormatter] class.

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Dimension] subclass is an abstract class that represents a dimensional unit, which can be converted into different units of the same type. The Foundation framework provides several concrete [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Dimension] subclasses to represent the most common physical quantities, including mass, length, duration, and speed.

### Subclassing Notes

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Unit] is intended for subclassing. For dimensional units, you should use one of the Apple provided [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Dimension] subclasses listed in Table 1 of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Dimension], or create a custom subclass of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Dimension]. You can create a direct subclass of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Unit] to represent a custom dimensionless unit, such as a count, score, or ratio.

## Accessing Properties

- **symbol**: The symbolic representation of the unit.

## Creating Units

- **init(symbol:)**: Initializes a new unit with the specified symbol.

## Essentials

- **Measurement**: A numeric quantity labeled with a unit of measure, with support for unit conversion and unit-aware calculations.
- **NSMeasurement**: A numeric quantity labeled with a unit of measure, with support for unit conversion and unit-aware calculations.
- **Dimension**: An abstract class representing a dimensional unit of measure.
